resources.string: Shopping mall located in the affluent Buckhead district of Atlanta. Owned by Simon Property Group.
This upscale shopping mall offers a large variety of independent and national shops and restaurants.
This upscale retail area has high-end shops for fashion and home goods, plus elegant restaurants.
Buckhead Atlanta, until May 2011 called Streets of Buckhead, is a 9-acre planned mixed-use development in the Buckhead district.
An upscale enclosed super regional shopping mall located in the Buckhead district of Atlanta, Georgia.
An upscale super regional shopping mall in Dunwoody, Georgia. The mall has over 200 stores and 4 anchor stores including Dillards, Macys, Nordstrom, and Von Maur.
Run by the Junior League, this shop offers previously worn name-brand clothing.
A neighborhood on the northwestern edge of Midtown Atlanta, Georgia, United States comprising a retail district, office space, condominiums, townhomes and apartment buildings.
Underground Atlanta is a shopping and entertainment district in the Five Points neighborhood of downtown Atlanta, Georgia, United States, near the Five Points MARTA station.
Consignment retailer offering high-end designer clothes, shoes and accessories.
This sleek nightclub with luxe decor is a lively spot for dancing and private party table service.
Tri-level lounge and dance club with outdoor Tropical Deck, plush velvet seating and 4 bars.
Sophisticated indoor/outdoor rooftop lounge in the W Hotel serving craft cocktails amid city views.
Flashy, bi-level nightspot with lavish decor, DJs and bottle service, plus an enforced dress code.
The lounge below the Biltmore Hotel features a backlit onyx bar, small dance floor and roster of DJs.

Opera Nightclub is a nightclub located in Midtown Atlanta, Georgia, United States. It is Atlantas most popular and successful nightclub in terms of revenue and attendance and has also been featured in Nightclub and Bars Top 50 Clubs in the United States for 2015.
Lively lounge in a grand home has sandwiches, burgers and pizza, plus brunch with bottomless mimosas.
A creative cocktail bar with exposed brick walls and low lighting, hidden at the back of a pizzeria.
Tiny underground hangout draws crowds for high-energy dance parties with DJ-spun beats.
Cocktail Bar Stylish, low-profile venue featuring cocktails and high-end bar snacks in a Prohibition-era setting.
Craft cocktails, small plates and cigars offered in a chic speakeasy entered through a phone booth.
Snazzy bistro offering clever sandwiches (Aporkalypse Now) by day and New Southern cuisine by night.
Sister Louisas Church of the Living Room and Ping Pong Emporium
Church-themed bar with picnic-style eats, church-organ karaoke and weekly Ping-Pong tournaments.
Dinner-only eatery with New American fare, elegant black-and-white decor and secret wine cellar table.
Farm-to-table New American cuisine in an elegant garden setting overlooking the Chattahoochee River.
Lobster rolls, gumbo, wood-fired oysters and more in a lofty, country-modern space with a raw bar.
Upscale setting for seafood, prime cuts and an extensive wine list, plus live jazz Thursday-Saturday.
The New York-style deli goes contemporary at this upscale Jewish deli adorned with subway tiles.
Inventive Mexican fare with regional influences and Latin-inspired cocktails in a stylish setting.
Busy family-run pizzeria near Georgia Tech known for brick-oven pies, with communal seating and BYOB.
Comfortable yet classy restaurant focusing on bold Vietnamese food, plus family-style plates.
New American eatery with a farm-fresh, Southern-accented menu and a country-modern space.
Once a railroad station, this sleek eatery and raw bar serves farm-to-table entrees with French flair.
The largest aquarium in the Western Hemisphere with 10 million gallons of fresh and marine water and tens of thousands of animals.
Welcome to World of Coca-Cola in Atlanta, GA where you can spend the day interacting with multiple exhibits and sampling more than 100 different beverages.
Walkable, safe, vibrant and fun, youâ€™ll find world-class attractions, renowned dining, exquisite hotels and a host of entertainment options all nestled around Centennial Olympic Park.
The CNN Center is the world headquarters of CNN. The main newsrooms and studios for several of CNNs news channels are located in the building.

The High Museum of Art, located in Atlanta, is the leading art museum in the Southeastern United States. Located on Peachtree Street in Midtown, the citys arts district, the High is a division of the Woodruff Arts Center.
The Fox Theatre, a former movie palace, is a performing arts venue located at 660 Peachtree Street NE in Midtown Atlanta, Georgia, and is the centerpiece of the Fox Theatre Historic District.
The Fernbank Science Center is a museum, classroom, and woodland complex located in Atlanta.
Martin Luther King Jr. Natural Historic Site

The Martin Luther King Jr. National Historic Site consists of several buildings including Martin Luther King Jr.s boyhood home and the original Ebenezer Baptist Church, the church where King was baptized and both his father Martin Luther King Sr., and he were pastors.
The Atlanta History Center is a history museum and research center located in the Buckhead district of Atlanta, Georgia.
The Atlanta Botanical Garden is a 30 acres botanical garden located adjacent to Piedmont Park in Midtown Atlanta.
